Our 8th grade class started their virtual day at the US Capitol touring the building with the help of US Representative, Dan Kildee. Secondly, they met with Senator Debbie Stabbenow and Jeremy Marhle from the United States Senate. We are so grateful to both government officials for taking time out of their busy schedules to present unique opportunities to our students.

The third speakers of the day were Wellington Watts and Sarah Buchanan from Alexandria Ghosts tours in Alexandria, VA. They told stories of Alexandria from long ago and how some believe they still haunt the city.

Bringing DC to our students, we continue to dare to be remarkable.

It's the special time of year at Holly Academy when we prepare for the induction of new members into our chapter of the National Junior Honor Society. This week 54 students received notification that they were eligible to apply for membership! Any 6th -8th grader who earned all A's or B's and all 1's or 2's in citizenship for the first two marking periods has the honor to apply. Once applications are received by February 14, the Holly Academy NJHS Faculty Council will score applications and make their selections. All candidates are anonymous to the council. Applications are based on their quality which includes areas of community service, student activities and recognition/awards. Students also prepare an essay promoting their candidacy. Best of luck candidates!

post_text: Tough tournament for our 5th/6th grade boys' basketball team as they lost their first two games and are out of the end of season tournament. Being true Huskies, there is a lot to learn from their season and tournament! The players never gave up; exhibited great sportsmanship throughout the season; learned a lot from beginning to end; and made great friendships both on the team and opposing teams! Other coaches and Athletic Directors went out of their way to compliment Mr. Melero about our players and parents! Our trophy case has a great collection of trophies, but there are lots of life lessons that don’t result in a trophy! Congratulations to Liam C. For earning the Good Sportsmanship award for our team! Lastly, a huge thanks to coach Billy J Melton for a great season!
